column4: Hello. to be able to build an application i need "gdk_pixbuf-2.0" but i cant find that package in apt-cache - any tips please?
the package you are looking for is called libgdk-pixbuf2.0-dev
this package does not exist on my Ubuntu 10.04

oh. in that case its probably because you are on an outdated system. ( not technically speaking, it still has some life left in it, but some packages are available only on the more up to date systems)
so if i were you i would either try and update your system, or i would just download the source code from somewhere.
i found a site that has the source code if you still need it: http://linux.softpedia.com/get/Programming/Libraries/gdk-pixbuf-58007.shtml
thank you!
no problem
oh, how do you untar *.xz files? *shy smile*
well, if you are using ubuntu there should be a extract here thing in nautilus. other wize just go into a terminal and type tar xvf <filename>
*wise
archive type not supported, hmph
then just go into the terminal and untar it using tar xvf <filename>
that wont work either
oh. do you have tar installed
tar: xz: Cannot exec: No such file or directory
it requires the binary for whatever the format handles
im not sure what the actual package name is, but its something along the line of xz utils
lzma is the name i suppose?
so do apt-cache search xz-utils and then install it
btw, this appears to be a known bug. there are several bug reports on this issue. the solution is generally to actually install the xz utils
